strategy.transcript:
Jane Vandemar: Cards Marketing Director. Pleased to meet you.

You’ll know, no doubt, that our bank is one of the largest in the UK with over 15 million customers across all segments. And you’ll also appreciate we’re a longstanding client of Visa’s, so we’re relying on you to fix this current problem of ours.

As it stands, we’re losing cross-border revenue to challenger banks when our customers go abroad. We believe this could be addressed by identifying potential travelers for targeted marketing campaigns, but we’re currently struggling to do this.

We believe that our customers often forget about our cards travel benefits and reminding them of these could help us improve spend. What we need is an automated marketing solution that identifies customers before they travel and messages them to remind them of the perks of using our cards abroad. It must be both accurate and cost-efficient, mind. We want to avoid adversely affecting our customer experience by bombarding them with marketing that’s irrelevant to their situation – that’s just irritating.

Now, we have a slight issue: the Head of Scheme, Marcus Croup, has expressed concerns about automation being the way we proceed in terms of our marketing. He worries about ‘relying on machines’, long development queues, and so forth. But, from where I stand, it has to be this way because we simply don’t have the capacity within our communications team. I trust you’ll do what you can to win him over?

I hope you can help us to get this cross-border revenue issue sorted as best we can. I’ll leave it to you to come up with a viable solution.
